CO and CH 4 , respectively.The outstanding performance results from the introduction of W 18 O 49 with abundant oxygen vacancies.Furthermore, as can be seen from Figure 5c,d, with the increase of the reaction time, the CO evolution amount of W 18 O 49 g-C 3 N 4 composite photocatalysts gradually increases whether under the irradiation of full spectrum light or nearinfrared light, suggesting that the as-prepared photocatalysts possess good stability.The multiple-cycle photocatalytic activity diagram of the

local surface plasmonic resonance (LSPR) of W 5 also contributed to the realization of efficient photocatalysis under near-infrared light.The Z-scheme electron transport model could realize the efficient separation of light-induced e --h pairs and reduce the recombination rate, thereby boosting the CO 2 photocatalytic reduction process.

In this work, an urchinlike W 18 O 49 g-C 3 N 4 composite was fabricated via a simple hydrothermal process.The photocatalytic CO 2 conversion reaction was applied to evaluate the photocatalytic behavior of this catalytic system, and the WOCN-20 wt heterojunction displayed superior photocatalytic behavior under full spectrum light irradiation, which was 6.46 molh -1 g -1 for CO and 3.97 molh -1 g -1 for CH 4 , respectively.Furthermore, in the near-infrared region, the composite photocatalysts also displayed

the combination of g-C 3 N 4 and W 18 O 49 , the photocatalytic behavior is significantly improved.In the composite photocatalyst, WOCN-20 wt reveals the greatest photocatalytic behavior under the irradiation of full spectrum light (6.46 molh -1 g -1 for CO and 3.97 molh -1 g -1 for CH 4 ).The corresponding apparent quantum yield of WOCN-20 wt composite is 2.2 (420 nm).The CO and CH 4 generation rates of WOCN-20 wt are 5.62-and 4.78-fold higher than those of g-C 3 N 4 , respectively.Moreover, gas

The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
